msDesc.head: Johannes Marienwerder, Matthew of Cracow, sermons, etc.; Germany (Kottbus), 1419

msItem.note: Alphabetical index to the following item
msItem.incipit: Pro tabula exposicionis symboli apostolorum est sciendum. Quod totus liber est digestus distinctus in xiij partes
Adoracio triplex est adoracio articulo viijo
msItem.explicit: [Christus] arma christi apparebunt in iudicio ar. vjo.

msItem.author: Johannes de Marienwerder
msItem.title: Dicta super symbolo Apostolorum
msItem.incipit: (fol. 4rb) Venite ambulemus in lumine ... Qui volumus prout debemus et fide credibilium proficere
(fol. 9vb) Credo in deum patrem ... In hoc symbolo fides benedicte trinitatis
msItem.explicit: qui stas in littore celestis patrae me expectans. Per Jesum Christum dominum nostrum ...
msItem.colophon: (fol. 57vb) Expliciunt dicta super Symbolo apostolorum reuerendi Magistri et doctoris sacre theologie Johannis de Marienwerder Canonici ecclesie ibidem. A me Johanne Ostralo. presbitero de Cottebus. conscripta. Anno meo xxixº. in ciuitate kottebus In vigilia sancte virginis Margarete hora quasi ixª. Anno domini mº.cccc xixº.

title.supplied: Sermo de indigna familiaritate extranearum mulierum

msItem.incipit: Nemo dicat fratres quod temporibus nostris martirum certamina esse non possunt
msItem.explicit: proclamamus cum propheta Oculi mei semper ad dominum ...

title.supplied: Gratia Dei, sermo de omnibus sanctis siue de octo beatitudinibus

msItem.incipit: Videns iesus turbas Matt vto Crisoss’ super Matt’ ostendens quomodo predicator accendit ex multitudine auditorum et tepescit ex paucitate hominum qui tepide audiunt verbum dei
msItem.explicit: non propter iusticiam passus es sed propter causam priuatam. Sequitur Beati Beati estis cum maledixerunt.
msItem.note: Incomplete. For the Gratia Dei see Pavel Spunar Repertorium auctorum Bohemorum (1985–95), no. 442, with full inventory of incipits in M. Andersson-Schmitt, H. Hallberg and M. Hedlund, Mittelalterliche Handschriften der Universitätsbibliothek Uppsala: Katalog über die C-Sammlung (1988-), s.v. hss. C 264, C 265, C 325.

msItem.author: Johannes de Marienwerder
msItem.title: De octa beatitudinibus
msItem.incipit: Beatitudines sunt habitus virtutum consumati
msItem.explicit: ad fontes aquarum ut sit cum ipso sponso desiderabilissimo Et hoc nobis concedat qui sine fine vivit et regnat Amen
msItem.finalRubric: Expliciunt dicta siue collecta reuerendi magistri et doctoris Johannis de Maryenwerder circa octa beatitudines optima et multum deuotis utilia
msItem.note: Jakub Simek, Die "Acht Seligkeiten" des Prager Predigers Heinrich von St. Gallen (2013), pp. 250–271

msItem.title: Sermons, etc.
msItem.note: Attributed in part to Matthew of Cracow (fols. 72v, 74v, 81v, 83, 84, 89, 92v), 'magister Petrus' (fol. 86v), and 'magister Provyn (?)' (fol. 95v). None of the sermons attributed to Matthew can be identified in the collections currently associated with him: the Sermones de sanctis 'Mens humana' (below, item 5); the Sermones de sanctis 'Piper' (incipits Materiały do historii teologii sredniowiecznej w Polsce: 1. Mateusza z Krakowa Opuscula theologica (Warsaw, 1974), 109–22), or the Sermones de sanctis 'Hic dicit Haymo' (incipits ibid., 123–9)

msItem.incipit: Egressus iesus perambulabat yericho [Luke 19.1] Hic informat pt hominem ad opera vite active quantum adincipientes
msItem.explicit: pastor visitate oues suas cum sint disperse

msItem.rubric: Sermo de Natiuitate b. virginis marie M. Matthei de Cracouia
msItem.incipit: Que est ista que ascendit sicud aurora consurgens pulcra ut luna electa ut sol terribilis ut Castrorum acies ordinata [Cant. 6.9] Sic scribitur Can.orum vjo. Prologus Ambrosii in quodam Sermone presentis festivitatis sic inquit. Inter omnium sanctorum
msItem.explicit: dyabolus non poterit eam fugare. Betamus ergo beatum uirginem.

msItem.rubric: In natiuitate gloriose virginis marie M. Matteus
msItem.incipit: Ferculum fecit sibi rex salomon de lignis libani columpnas eius argenteas reclinatorium aureum ascensum eius purpureum et medium factum amore [Cant. 3.9–10] Nota quod antequam accedatur ad ewangelium et thema propositum

msItem.rubric: Sermo de visitacione gloriosissime virginis marie ad elizabeth
msItem.incipit: Exsurgens autem maria in diebus illis abiit in montana cum festinatione in ciuitatem iuda etc. [Luke 1.39] Verba ewangelii que sunt legi in diebus presentis festivitatis scribit luc’ 1o capitulo. Et sciedum ut habeatis

msItem.rubric: Sermon in die purificacionis uirginis gloriose
msItem.incipit:
Postquam impleti sunt dies purgacionis
Scribitur Luc. ijo capitulo. Prologus unus sanctus Ambrosius in quodam sermone hodierne festivitatis

msItem.rubric: Sermo M. Mathei beate virginis marie in die Assumpcionis
msItem.incipit: Intravit iesus in quoddam castellum et mulier quaedam nomine martha accepit illum in domum suam Luc. x. capitulo Antequam accedam ad ewangelii materiam Capio dictum quoddam quod scribit beatus Bernhardus
Intravit iesus in quoddam castellum Pro castellum secundum Anshelmum intelligitur beata virgo

msItem.rubric: In octava assumpcionis beate virginis Mr. Mattheus
msItem.incipit:
In omnibus requiem quesiui
Sic scribitur Sapiencie vijo capitulo. Sed dicit beatus Jeronimus cum apostolo in Epistola ad Eufacachium

msItem.rubric: Sermo in die marie magdalene M. Petri
msItem.incipit: Rogauit iesum quidam pharizeus ut man Luc vijo [recte 11?] Exquo sumus peccatores magni et dui meruissemus dampnari

msItem.rubric: Sermo de beata katherina M. Matthei
msItem.incipit: Surge propera amica mea formosa mea columba mea [Cant. 2.10] Sic scribit sapiens in canticis canticorum. Antequam transsitur ad materiam verborum ac exposicionem

Omnis gloria eius filie regis ab intus in fymbriis aureis
Scribitur Ps.o 44o. Mos est scripture sacre quod corporis decorem pulcritudinemque extrinsicam non multum laudat

msItem.rubric: In die sancti Steffani Mr. Matteus
msItem.incipit: Ecce ego mitto ad vos prophetas et scribas Mt. 4o Prologus heri audiuisitis quomodo angeli nuncciauerunt pacem in terris

msItem.rubric: In die sanctii Procopii Mr. Provyn
msItem.incipit: sint lumbi uestri precincti Luc. xjo [12.35] In verbis istis saluator non notat aliud nisi quod debemus nos disponere
Caro mea vero est cibus Jo. vj Dominus iesus ostendit se iudeis esse panem reficientem
Nota ysiderus de Summon bono dicit quod in quolilbet iudicio de Iure communi 4or persone requiritur
Hii sunt quos aliquando habemus in derisum et in similitudinem improperij ... [Sap. 5.3–5] Quantum ad primum, Hii sunt quos aliquando, Job xij deridere iusti simplicitas
msItem.explicit: ad nichilum deduces omnes gentes etc.

msItem.incipit: Nota auaricia est immoderatus appetitus diuiciarum in quibus creatura magis quam creator diligitur et alio modo vocatur cupiditas siue ambicio

msItem.rubric: Incipiunt Postille de Sanctis magistri Gorre

msItem.incipit: Ambulans iesus iuxta mare Galilee Mt. iiijto Mens humana homini in est quam pena est peccata a primis parentibus comissi

msItem.rubric: (fol. 135rb) Expliciunt Postille de Sanctis. Secuntur de Communi Sanctoruem

msItem.incipit: Ecce ego mitto vos Mt. x Inter omnia que predicatori necessaria sunt patentia necessarior est
Respiciens iesus uidit eos etc. Luc. xxj Karissimi omnes videmus et sepius experimur
msItem.explicit: castitatis fixa 1 Cor. viijo [7.8]dico autem non nuptis scilicet viduis bonum est illis manere sicud ego. Rogemus

msItem.note: Mostly as pr. Bożena Chmielowska (Warsaw, 1984), and listed by Schneyer (2001) under ‘Virgilius Wallendorfer of Salzburg’. Sermons 28–34, and parts of 27 and 35, are lost due to the excision of (apparently) eight leaves between fols. 144 and 145. Nos. 20 and 45 in Chmielowska's sequence do not occur here.
Matthias Nuding, Matthäus von Krakau. Theologe, Politiker, Kirchenreformer in Krakau, Prag und Heidelberg zur Zeit des Großen Abendländischen Schismas (Tübingen, Mohr Siebeck, 2007) p. 258 etc.
Items on fols. 108rb-109vb interrupt the sequence, in the middle of serm. 3 (as noted fol. 108rb):

msItem.incipit: Legitur quod beata Walpurga fuit nata in regione Sabulon filia regis Saraces
msItem.explicit: tulerunt corpus puelle et sepelierunt aromatibus in ciuitate Walpurdis Anno domini Mºcccc

msItem.incipit: Assumpsit iesus xij discipulos suos et ait illis Ecce ascendimus Ierosolymam Mt. xviijo [Luke 18.31] Solent homines et specialiter uenatores istius temporis
Assumpsit iesus etc. [Luke 18.31] Quidam doctor dicit quod ecclesia sancta nunquam populus turbatur per mundanam
In momento in ictu oculi in nouissima tuba canet enim tuba et mortui resurgent incorrupti ad thesselonii 4to [1 Cor. 15.52] In his verbis apostoli describitur futura resurreccio
Omnes morimur et quasi aqua dilabimur in terra que non revertuntur 2o R. xiiijo Fratres consideremus mortem momentis omnibus meditandam

msItem.title: Stella Clericorum
msItem.incipit: Quasi stella matutina in media nebule id est peccatorum. Proprietates huius stelle
msItem.explicit: confiteamur nomini sancto tuo et gloriemur in laude tua in eternum. Quod prestare dignetur qui vivit et regnat in secula seculorum amen
msItem.note: Identified by Eric Reiter as a distinctive version also found in Admont, Stiftsbibliothek, MSS. 433, 522; Klosterneuburg, Stiftsbibliothek, MS. 538; St. Pölten, Diözesanbibliothek, MS 9 (Eric H. Reiter, ‘The "Stella Clericorum" and its readers: A study of the reception of popular theology in the later Middle Ages’, PhD disseration, University of Toronto, 1994, p. 87 n. 140.)

msItem.incipit: Ecce uenit dicit dominus conuertimini ad me Johelis 2o Presens leccio potest diuidi in duo. Primo deus per illam propheciam swadet hominibus peccatoribus efficaciter
msItem.note: (Glorieux, Théol. 349h2); part of the opening sermon.

supportDesc.extent: 172 fols. (the final two folios are fragmentary and are followed by further fragments) 306 220

handDesc.handNote: Written by Johannes Ostralus of Kottbus colophon, fol. 57v, covering fols. 1–57v. The rest of the manuscript is in the same hand.

binding.p: Whittawed leather over boards, 15th century. The upper board has an offset from a former pastedown, no longer present. Two strap-and-pin fastenings, mostly lost; 4+1 bosses on the front and back boards, lost.

history.provenance: Largely illegible ownership inscription on the inside back cover: Liber Joh leg ff e cotbus ('e cotbus' probably later). (Read by Watson as 'Liber presbiteri Johannis ostrali presbiteri de cotbus'.)
Cisterican abbey of Neuzelle, near Guben (Gubin), 15th century: 'Dominus michael frengkel assignavit pro testamento librum presentem ad nouam cellam prope gubin' (fol. 1).
history.acquisition: Presented to the Bodleian Library by his sons and received in 1857.

recordHist.source: Description by Matthew Holford (June 2019, rev. Oct. 2019). Previously described in the Summary Catalogue (1905). Summary Catalogue, Vol. 5, p. 12 Summary Catalogue, Vol. 5, p. 13

ref.title: Manuscripts from German-Speaking Lands – A Polonsky Foundation Digitization Project

listBibl.bibl: A. G. Watson, Catalogue of Dated and Datable Manuscripts c.435–1600 in Oxford Libraries (Oxford, 1984), no. 491

revisionDesc.change: Description of fols. 59ra-65ra revised, some transcription errors corrected, numbering of items revised.
